casebody.data:
In re Booth’s Will. (Supreme Court, General Term, First Department. June 6, 1890.) Motion for new trial on exceptions. For former report, see 6 M. T. Supp. 41.

Argued before Van Brunt, P. J., and Brady and Daniels, JJ. .

J. S. Boss, for proponent. B. F, Watson, for contestant. *945Per Curiam.

Under the law as laid down by this court upon the previous appeals in this case, the proponent’s motions for a new trial and for judgment must be denied, and the motion of the contestant for judgment granted, with costs.
